Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Game extends Object implements Runnable
Represents the main game logic for the card game. The Game class handles the initialization, turn management, round play, scoring, and winner determination. It manages the communication between players and ensures that each round and the game overall follows the rules.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(Server server)
      Initializes a new Game instance with the provided server.
      Parameters:
      server - the server that hosts the game

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the main game loop, checking for the winning condition based on tokens and playing rounds until the game is complete.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • game

      public void game()
      Main game logic to initialize token requirements, determine player order, and manage rounds until the win condition is met.

    • initializeRound

      public void initializeRound()
      Initializes the round by resetting player stats, shuffling the deck, and dealing cards to players.

    • playRound

      public void playRound()
      Manages the sequence of turns in a round until one player remains or the deck is empty. Determines the winner if the round ends.

    • playerFinishedTurn

      public void playerFinishedTurn()
      Notifies the game that the current player has finished their turn.

    • lastManStanding

      public int lastManStanding()
      Counts players still in the round who are not knocked out.
      Returns:
      the count of players still in the round.

    • roundWinner

      public void roundWinner()
      Determines the winner of a round and updates their token count.

    • roundWinnerDeck

      public void roundWinnerDeck()
      Determines the winner of a round if the deck is empty, comparing card values.

    • gameWinner

      public void gameWinner()
      Determines the winner of the game based on tokens.

    • compareDiscardedCardsValue

      public void compareDiscardedCardsValue()
      Compares the discarded card values of players to determine the winner when there is a tie. The player with the highest discarded card value wins the round.

    • compareValueOfCards

      public void compareValueOfCards()
      Compares the values of players' current cards to determine the round winner when the deck is empty. If there is a tie in card values, compares discarded card values to break the tie.

    • orderOfLastDate

      private void orderOfLastDate()
      Sorts players by the time of their last date, and if tied, by their age to determine the order of play. Sets the first player name and updates the turn order map.

    • youngestPlayer

      private Player youngestPlayer()
      Determines the youngest player among those with the highest discarded card value in case of a tie.
      Returns:
      the youngest player with the highest discarded card value.

    • updateOrderOfPlay

      private void updateOrderOfPlay(Player player)
      Updates the turn order for the next round based on the player who won the last round. Resets the turn order map and assigns new turn orders.
      Parameters:
      player - the player who won the last round and will start the next round.

    • resetPlayerStats

      public void resetPlayerStats()
      Resets player statistics at the end of a round.

    • resetGameStats

      public void resetGameStats()
      Resets the game statistics, allowing a new game to be started.

    • tokenInfo

      public void tokenInfo()
      Broadcasts the token information for each player to all players.
